etymology.description: Simplified from the traditional character 孫 where 系 is simplified to 小.
etymology.interpretation: The traditional character 孫 consists of two parts: 子 (zǐ, son) and 系 (xì, continue), forming an ideogrammic compound that suggests lineage or continuation through descendants. In the simplified character 孙, the component 系 has been replaced with 小 (xiǎo, small), reducing the number of strokes and simplifying the character.
etymology.simplification: The simplification involved reducing strokes by replacing the component 系 with 小 under 子 in the traditional character.

examples.chinese: 孙女在家里玩。 (孫女在家裡玩。)
examples.english: The granddaughter is playing at home.

examples.chinese: 他的孙子今年上大学。 (他的孫子今年上大學。)
examples.pinyin: Tā de sūnzi jīnnián shàng dàxué.
examples.english: His grandson is going to college this year.

examples.chinese: 孙悟空是一个有名的文学角色。 (孫悟空是一個有名的文學角色。)
examples.pinyin: Sūn Wùkōng shì yīgè yǒumíng de wénxué juésè.
examples.english: Sun Wukong is a famous literary character.
